description: Borrowed from Japanese 焼き鳥 (やきとり), from 焼き (yaki, “grilled, toasted”) + 鳥 (tori, “bird”).

nouns.description: yakitori (countable and uncountable, plural yakitori or yakitoris)

entries.meaning: A Japanese shish kebab-type dish made with small pieces of chicken or other ingredients cooked on skewers, often marinated in soy sauce or seasoned with salt.
examples: We should have the bazaars full of yakitori pitches and geishas in bamboo cages.
